basics.name: Marcus Cropley
basics.label: Engineering Technician
basics.summary: Born in raised in New Orleans, I am passionate about my community and sustainable development. With experience in data analytics, environmental service, and an education in economics, I strive to apply my unique skillset wherever it is needed.

work.name: Terracon Consultants
highlights: Conduct comprehensive field investigations, including soil and materials testing, to assess project feasibility and compliance with regulatory requirements
Collaborate closely with engineers and project managers to analyze data, prepare technical reports, and provide valuable insights for decision-making
Utilize specialized software and tools to process and interpret data, contributing to accurate project documentation and reporting
Perform laboratory testing of soils and other materials

Community Involvement.summary: Co-Founder, and Sustainable Building Instructor at a community workshop
highlights: Founding member and instructor of a community workshop aiming to create equitable access to art classes
Manage the collection and use of repurposed materials for lessons
Outreach to schools, community groups, and New Orleans based artists to collaborate our ideas, events, and resources

Community Involvement.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: The rank of Eagle Scout is the highest achievable rank in Boy Scouts. It involved years of community service, leadership, and persevearance to achieve this aspiration. My Eagle Scout Project involved constructing garden boxes for a community garden, known as Clouet Park, in the 9th ward.
